title: Quinta do Crasto 2018 Vinha Maria Teresa Red (Douro)
description: Fermented in stone lagars, this wine has a rich, open character. From a field blend of old vines, it is impressively structured and densely textured. The black fruits and powerfully ripe tannins will take time. Drink the wine from 2025.

title: Handley 2018 RSM Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This graceful, layered and subtle wine deftly blends delicious plummy fruit with judicious oak spices and a hint of earthy, forest floor aromas. A gentle mouthfeel, medium to full body and lingering finish make it easy to keep sipping. It's the best of Handley's 2018s, and great to drink through 2028.

title: Vineyard 7&8 2018 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)
description: This beautiful 100% varietal wine from the high-elevation estate is partially barrel-fermented and shows sophisticated tannin management and texture. Bay leaf, sage and cedar accent a full-bodied and concentrated core of complex red currant and cassis, with a girth of toasted oak, tobacco and cigar box playing secondary parts. Enjoy best from 2028 through 2038.

title: Reeve 2018 Wendling Vineyard North Slope Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: This is a big but agile wine, framing ample, just-ripe black-cherry, cranberry and mint flavors in moderate tannins and lively acidity for great balance and good aging potential. Excellent concentration keeps the fruit and mild oak spice notes echoing on the finish. Best from 2026.

title: Lula 2019 Lula Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Gorgeous black fruits and enticing oak spice elements give this full-flavored, layered and well-structured wine more than enough pleasure. While rich, ripe and nicely nuanced with baking spices like vanilla, cinnamon and nutmeg, good underlying acidity and moderate fine-grained tannins keep it fresh and appetizing. Best from 2026.

title: Beauregard 2019 Bald Mountain Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Stony aromas of seashell hover above the Asian pear, jicama, white-flower and light spearmint aromas on the fascinating nose of this bottling. The stony streak cascades through the palate, which is like licking limestone but with fuller flavors of lemony apple and quince. The acid-driven finish lingers for an extended period.
